intro: Hieracium praeradians, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. It produces yellow flowers that are often surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Hieracium praeradians is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in dry conditions.
